alert.note: Alert for Boone; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 5:03PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Raleigh, Wyoming and southeastern Boone Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 502 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Oceana, or near Pineville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Beckley, Pineville, Mullens, Mabscott, Oceana, Sophia, Crab Orchard, Dry Creek, Macarthur, Bradley, Shady Spring, Beaver, Piney View, Stanaford, Coal City, Prosperity, Twin Falls State Park, Daniels, Lester and Rhodell. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 28 and 52. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 120 and 137. Route 19 between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming
